forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southwest wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day reveals itself with a sunny disposition that brushes against the cool morning air. As the sun arcs higher, temperatures reach around 60 degrees, yet a gentle discontent arises from the impending transformation of the atmosphere—clouds gather whispers of rain for later tonight as the south-southwest winds flirt with the chill of the bay, stirring what could become a quiet, drizzly affair. The visibility is refreshingly clear, showcasing the elegance of the Golden Gate and the sharp lines of the skyline, although one can sense a hesitancy hanging in the air, foreshadowed by the 90% chance of precipitation after 11 PM.

As the day unfolds, the clear skies beg for leisurely explorations; a walk along the waterfront or a visit to the nearby parks could be a delightful use of your time, the fresh air invigorating after months of more subdued weather. Dress in layers to appreciate the warmth of the sun now, while easily adapting to the cooler breezes that will dance their way in by evening. It’s a day that opens doors not only to the vibrancy of the city but also to the profound stillness found in quiet contemplation as clouds curl and gather, preparing to bless the ground with rain by nightfall.
